item.title: Introduction of GDAL with R programming
item.description: Getting started with gdal GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) is a translator library for raster and vector geospatial data formats. It is released under an MIT style Open Source License by the Open Source Geospatial Foundation. As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data model and single vector abstract data model to the calling application for all supported formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line utilities for data translation and processing 1.
